frame.name: Alliance
frame.definition:
<def-root>After having worked separately for some time, two or more organizational or individual <fen>Members</fen> are now organized in an <fen>Alliance</fen> so that they may better pursue some common <fen>Purpose</fen>s. The formerly separate <fen>Members</fen> may be presented separately as <fen>Member_1</fen> and <fen>Member_2</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Members">They</fex> formed a <fex name="Descriptor">loose</fex> <fex name="Alliance"><t>coalition</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Alliance
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity of which the individuals are <fen>Members</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Members
FE.definition: <def-root>The persons or groups belonging to the <fen>Alliance</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which an <fen>Alliance</fen> is formed.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_existence
FE.definition:
<def-root>The interval during which the <fen>Alliance</fen> exists.
<ex>Hezbollah was founded in 1982 in response to the Israeli invasion of Lebanon, and subsumed members of the <fex name="per">1980s</fex> <t>coalition</t> of groups known as Islamic Jihad.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Member_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>That group or individual which has joined the <fen>Alliance</fen> which is grammatically more prominent when the <fen>Members</fen> are presented separately.
<ex><fex name="me1">Our</fex> <t>alliance</t> with Japan is the cornerstone of Asia-Pacific security strategy.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Member_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>That group or individual which has joined the <fen>Alliance</fen> which is grammatically less prominent when the <fen>Members</fen> are presented separately.
<ex>Thanks in part to their <t>coalition</t> <fex name="me2">with McCoy</fex>, but thanks also to their seniority and the knowledge of some of their leaders, they hold considerable influence </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of some property of the <fen>Alliance</fen>.
<ex>The two leaders enjoy an <fex name="Descriptor">uneasy</fex> <t>alliance</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: alliance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a union or association formed for mutual benefit

lexUnit.name: coalition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a temporary alliance, especially of political parties forming a government.
